answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some resources you might find useful in helping you get started.
I have included an ICMA article about becoming an adjunct professor. It includes some helpful links.
http://icma.org/en/icma/career_network/education/teaching_resources/go_teach
There is also a Knowledge Network group for managers who teach. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/groups/group/1112
ICMA also has a list of instructor resources you can access below.
http://bookstore.icma.org/Resources_for_Instructors_W9.cfm
And you can also visit the Adjunct Corner created by ICMA and the Urban Management Committees of the National Association of Schools of Public Affairs and Administration (NASPAA).
http://www.naspaa.org/principals/resources/adjunct.asp
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

answers.author: Ian Coyle
answers.text:
I teach online for various programs.  You really need to seek and find these vacancies. The traditional teacher recruitment sites like The Chronicle and HigherEdJobs will have adjunct postings.   Alternatively, you can visit school sites directly like Kaplan, DeVry, Phoenix, etc.  NASPAA's site, referenced above, does have a listing of online programs, which is a start.

author: [Anonymous]
text: I am looking for adjunct teaching opportunities for online courses. We have a program locally, but, so far teaching opportunities are held the same night as my Board meetings. I have experience in teaching. If anybody has any contacts or resources, please let me know. Thank you.
title: Adjunct Faculty Online
